subsection.name: Resolving Sitemap Items
subsection.p: This module resolves a sitemap index file, which contains the locations of all the sitemaps of the site. A sitemap can contain up to 50.000 (unique) sitemap items. More items will result in multiple sitemaps. To provide Google all the sitemaps, a sitemap index file will be created. A sitemap index file is an overview of all the sitemaps that are relevant to the site, i.e. it simply indicates the locations of the multiple sitemaps. Again, it acts according the specifications provided by Google. See also HST Sitemap Crawler.

subsection.name: Configuration
subsection.p: In the console under hst:hst/hst:configurations/hst:default/hst:components exists a component called forge-sitemap-index-feed. This component renders the sitemap index file based on parameters, which are used in the component's class SitemapIndexFeed. These parameters can be set in the sitemapitem sitemapindex.xml, which can be found under hst:hst/hst:configurations/[YOURDOMAIN]/hst:sitemap. Here can the configurations and/or parameters be set. Only the parameter sitemap-location-foldername is required. The other parameters are optional, i.e. when these parameters are not filled, then they will be considered as not existing.
The parameter sitemap-location-foldername is the location where the sitemap files will be stored.

tr.td: The location of the sitemap folder, where the sitemap files are stored. These files will be used while generating the sitemap index file.

For some systems the sitemap index files are stored in the repository asset folder. These systems might use url rewriting. With this parameter a prefix can be configured, which is placed in front of the asset url.
Provide additional urls which must be added to the sitemap index

subsection.name: Admire the result
subsection.p:
Open your site in your browser, and check out your sitemap index!
(http://[YOURDOMAIN]/site/preview/sitemapindex.xml)
Your browser may not display the sitemap index as XML. View the page source to see the sitemap index XML.
